website_summaries.verdict: The spikeless iteration of the Adipower 4orged has surprised many skeptics as it performs just as well as the more traditional spiked pairs. The Adidas Adipower 4orged S marries style and performance, and that can be translated even after a round of golf. Thanks to the technologies used on this trainer, many have found a love affair wearing it. If not for the tongue shape that runs quite long, this low-top shoe is built almost close to perfection.
pros: Majority of the users have observed that the Adidas Adipower 4orged S is comfortable
Many claim that this has become their favorite and go-to pair since acquiring it
A significant amount of wearers who are skeptical of spikeless golf shoes feel surprised that these are grippy throughout the course
Several Boost fans are not disappointed by the cushioning system
A couple of golfers prefer this shoe over their existing FootJoy pair
The water-repellent upper is a practical feature that some find extremely practical
A small number of shoppers confirm that the material and the construction are of excellent quality
The upper is breathable and perfect for spring and summer wear, says a low percentage of testers
Few users have given extra points to the 4orged S because it minimizes the need for shoe changes before and after the game
cons: Many individuals complain about the tongue construction
Because it is longer than usual, it tends to rub on the high points of the foot, especially when wearing no-show socks

customer_reviews.title: SHARP TONGUE
customer_reviews.text: Pros: light shoe; after 18 holes, golf shoes can get heavy. These don't; played 27 holes and feet/legs weren't tired. Nice look to shoes. Don't think I would wear them on rainy days. Great in the heat. Con: the top of the tongue cut into my ankle or rather irritated it the first time I wore them. Next time, I bent the tongue back to lay against my sock. It worked. Another option is to wear higher cut v low cut ankle socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: *Incredible*
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous year's model of this shoe and loved that one as well before they ripped. I am a caddy working at a private country club and I put a lot of mileage on these kicks. The comfort levels are everything I could ask for and this particular model has been made sturdier and with some extra cushioning around the ankle area. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp tongue and soft toe area
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are beautiful but functionally, they're not that great. The Toe area kind of "collapses" so on the finish, my toes were starting to get irritated. But the biggest issue was the sharp tongue that digs into your skin. Yes, I can wear socks that cover the ankles but that kills the look on these shoes. Save some money and get the other golf shoes for $50.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Hurt Feet
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these shoes for three rounds (one riding in a cart) they began to hurt my feet. At first they seemed OK, but then my feet began to slide around when walking up or down any hill, and the sole felt like it did not provide proper support. They seemed to fit properly at first and were comfortable wearing around the house to test. Now ouch! I see several pairs on ebay that were all worn about three times before the owner decided to sell cheap. $130 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Alpaca Picnic

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe so far
customer_reviews.text: Took these out to walk 9 holes, and these were very comfortable the whole time. I have never had spikeless shoes before, it was a dry day but didn't have any traction issues (test will be when the ground is more soggy). I read comments about the tongue cutting into the ankle, and I can definitely see how that could be if your socks are lower than the tongue. Will update if I notice traction/comfort/durability issues that come with further use, but for now they work great and I love the look
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome golf shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I watched the Farmers Insurance Open and noticed Justin Rose's shoes .... I looked up and found he had a red and the blue Adidas spikeless shoes. Bought these and played with them in California a few days later and they were great! Fit was same as my tennis shoes. Look great and priced well ! I had nice Ecco's but glad to make the switch!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Ecco's exclusively for nearly 10 years and bought these on a whim due to a really good price. They aren't quite in the Ecco category for comfort and form fit, but a good alternate shoe especially for the price. If you're an Ecco die hard, these feel a just a bit more narrow, and the heel of the shoe feels a bit lower, otherwise there isn't much to complain about. I would buy them again at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe with a flaw
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs narrow, and the tongue design is flawed, it has a canvas feel rather than being padded and runs much higher than traditional so if you wear low cut socks the tongue will continuously rub on the upper ankle. It's unfortunate because it is a very comfortable golf shoe. Other reviews have stated the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Retired55

customer_reviews.title: My first spikeless, comfort > grip? So far yes!
customer_reviews.text: Prefacing this review with the statement that I've played several rounds in this pair but all in desert dry conditions. It's the most comfortable pair of golf shoes I ever owned, though it's the first spikeless I've owned. I loved all my other adidas spiked shoes over the years, but the rounds in this pair are the firsts where my feet didn't hurt after the round. And in dry conditions so far very little slipping and sliding compared to spiked shoes. As other reviewers mentioned, I don't quite understand why the tongue was made to protrude out so much. I took the advice from one of the reviews and just folded it under the lacing and it's a non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: taester

customer_reviews.title: Wide width not wide at all.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed....I ordered the wide width and it's not wide at all. Will probably be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable golf shoe that fits exactly to size. No slippage experienced in my first couple rounds with the bottom tread. Haven't walked a course yet in these but I don't see any reason why these wouldn't be excellent to that regard as well. Only complaint so far is the tongue is a bit protruding and digs into the shin a bit. Hopefully this will soften up over time and not be an issue but with very short socks, I was certainly feeling the edge of the tongue press against the front of my shins.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, fit, and price are excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and always end up buying shoes a size up with too much toe room, which cause my foot to slide. These wide shoes fit like a glove. I have flat feet so my feet usually hurt after playing. I played 18 on a hilly course the first time I wore them; my feet were comfortable and did not hurt. I have always worn cleats because I heard spineless shoes slip while swinging. I played on a wet course and did not have any problems with grip. Also, shoes are water proof. Highly recommend, excellent buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Cespedes

customer_reviews.title: First pair was too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I played my first round of golf yesterday wearing these shoes. They look and feel great, but I did have to send the first pair back because they were too narrow. I never have to buy "wide" shoes, but in this case I did. Other than the width the fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bodysolid48

customer_reviews.title: Best Golf Shoe I've ever worn - Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: As a walking golfer it's always been very important to me that shoes are really comfortable right out of the box so there is no break in period and/or blisters. The Adipower 4orged S golf shoes from adidas are excellent and having the Wide option was a gamechanger for me as adidas tend to fit too narrow for my foot. You could walk 36+ holes with a new pair out of the box and they'd perform from a traction/stability standpoint while also providing slipper like comfort. Phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Cavan Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and stylish.....but the tongue?
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are true to size, a little narrow but seem to stretch after worn. Very light and comfortable. Really like the style and look. The one downside.....THE TONGUE. As another reviewer noted the top of the rubs on the front of your shin and is very rough and uncomfortable. You can work around it by folding the top part under and seems to stay during your round. Overall great shoe but gave 4-stars because of the tongue.
customer_reviews.author: marinb

customer_reviews.title: Great golf shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've now played a good amount of golf in these shoes, probably 5 full rounds of 18 plus range time. These shoes are comfortable, give great grip, and look fantastic. I have nothing bad to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wiley

customer_reviews.title: You won’t go wrong with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 73 year old male that’s been playing golf for 45 years. The majority of that time I played with Footjoy golf shoes. They are comfortable and fit me perfectly every time. I decided to purchase these Adidas golf shoes hopping that they would be at least as good. I purchased two pairs and was not disappointed. The fit was perfect and the comfort was surprisingly even better than the Foot joys right out of the box. They were so great I ordered a third pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Held up against a wet course no problem
customer_reviews.text: Best Amazon warehouse deal I've ever found....$21! Put them to work in some quite wet conditions today and my feet were dry the whole time. Maybe not made to be fully waterproof but for normal use I think these will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jflower113

customer_reviews.title: Excellent casual golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously comfortable well-fitting casual golf shoes that still provide decent traction on the course.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Russo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for walking 18 holes
customer_reviews.text: Runs about a half size small. Plenty of room in the toe. It's a great shoe, particularly for walking. It's light weight, has decent traction, and keeps your feet cool. It's a very comfortable shoe which never wears out. They are very durable and well made. It's best used in dry conditions, although it can handle wet grass.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of golf shoes and I love them. I did have to put new insoles in them but that's because I have plantar fasciitis. I wore them for about two hours at the driving range today and no problems. Very stable in the turf. I'll definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on air, I will never wear spikes again!
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of golf shoes with turf soles and I will never go back to cleats/spikes. These are as comfortable as running shoes. I can't believe I waited so long to finally give up on the horseback riding golf shoes I've worn for the past 25yrs.
customer_reviews.author: DWeb

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, but seem a little flimsy. Also, the complaints about the tongue cutting into the ankle are valid. A thicker, padded tongue would go a long way on these. I might not have returned them if the tongue wasn’t so poor.
customer_reviews.author: P. Berndt

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable golf shoe, especially for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These are a very comfortable golf shoe. It wears and feels more like a sneaker than normal spikes shoes. They are very grippy for medium swing speeds like myself. I struggle to find a golf shoe that fits with wide feet and these felt great the moment I put them on. Not the most waterproof shoe out there but will suffice for dew in the mornings
customer_reviews.author: Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had these shipped to my golf trip destination. Although I am in my senior years, I still like to walk when I play. Picked them up, put them on and played 36 holes. Very comfortable and good support. And, they look good. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good old Amazon return deal
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfect and I have played about 15 rounds in these. I even wear them to/from the course as the spikes are not the traditional type so I anticipate that these will last for a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Peoria AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected, comfortable, and looks good. Much more comfortable for walking than the last shoes I had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow...not wide at all.
customer_reviews.text: If it was wide, it was slightly larger than a regular fit shoe. I couldn't even get them on and I bought a 1/2 size big.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These golf shoes are like walking on pillows! I walk 18 holes with these shoes 3 times a week. Don't listen to the people complaining about the tongue. Wear socks!! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Liebergot

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: these shoes look great. They are also very comfortable. I play a lot of golf so I rely on a great pair of golf shoes. These met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: The wide shoes are wide enough!
customer_reviews.text: I like them so far, used just once but seemed to keep my footing solid enough on the tee box, and my old long spikes aren't tearing up the greens!

customer_reviews.title: I wear these all the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for golf, and they work great, but now they’re the most comfortable shoes I own so I wear them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe...except for tongue design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Overall very comfortable, lightweight shoe. Not sure what Adidas was thinking with that tongue design as it wore away both of my ankles, while wearing no show socks. Solved by folding stitched edge under, but it’s an issue for a shoe I’d like to wear in warm weather. Would have been a 4+ except for that design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clancy

customer_reviews.title: was shocked!
customer_reviews.text: I was in shock when our son normally wears in any other shoe a 12 . they look great and here stated he can wear them all day long very comfortable. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Black shoes or white shoes??? These are perfect! Comfortable, durable and nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: For girls too! Just size down
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised how cute and comfortable they are. Can’t wait to try them out on the course
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tongue is sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This show was unwearable for me. Returned it. The tongue is sharp and digs into shin. Poor design and a shame as that messed up a great golf shoe otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought them!!! Easy to clean and very comfortable to walk the course in!
customer_reviews.author: vance campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes for the most part. Only real complaint is that the tongue is a bit too long so it rubs against your leg if you wear really short socks and can be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Morris

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wear with short socks
customer_reviews.text: I wear short socks and the tongue of the shoe is too long and rough. After wearing for the first time the tongue rubbed my skin so bad it was almost bleeding. I’ll only be able to wear these shoes with long socks. Very disappointed. Otherwise, the shoe is great.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie C.

customer_reviews.title: these shoes are way too small for the size stated
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 11 size shoe. I ordered a 11 1/2 and it was still to small. the tip of the shoe is really narrow for your toes. I was really disappointed in the fit
customer_reviews.author: richard l. stephens

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews are correct in stating that the tongue on this shoe is rather sharp and uncomfortable. I just rolled mine down, wore them out to play 9 holes the same day that I received them and love the shoes. Great grip and a great overall shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Great golf shoes - didn't have to break these in, they were comfortable on the first round of 18. No mud collects on the cleats, easy to leave them on all day after golfing in the morning. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hills

customer_reviews.title: the design met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: The size of the shoe fit exactly to my measurements of my feet. I ws totally surprised about this fact. I have not a chance to play a round of golf yet but I expect nothing but high expectations. Great Job ADIDAS
customer_reviews.author: L Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered wide Width and these shoes seem to be closer to regular width... way too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Wore these once for 18 holes, and I had a cart!! Got blisters on a toe and the tongue cut the top of my foot. Worsted shoes I ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: David O

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a dream. I have a wider foot and the “medium” fit works perfectly for me. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Shoes seem great but will update once I actually wear on course
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Logo On Tongue of Shoe Causes Abrasions
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfortable, but the Adidas logo on the tongue of the shoe should not extend beyond normal part of the tongue. It appears to have sizing (starch?) that makes it stiff and causes an abrasion on my ankles. Would return them but wore them once and thought that part of the shoe would soften. It did not.
customer_reviews.author: Chula Girl

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not wide
customer_reviews.text: Needed these in a wide for my husband. There is no way the ones we received were wide...be wary.
customer_reviews.author: Connie C

customer_reviews.title: Questionable size
customer_reviews.text: They feel great, but they are about 1/2 size smaller than Footjoys. If you want them to fit like Footjoys, I'd suggest bumping up a half size. I don't know which one is off, but that's my comparison. Most comfortable golf shoe I've worn. Maybe the most comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: John Greig

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: The tongue of this shoe is too long, and rubs against my angle, creating blister. Golf shoes are often worn with angle high socks, and the tongue rubs against your bare skin. Poor design
customer_reviews.author: roger d lay

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable golf shoes I've tried coming from a 250 lb man. I have tried several different brands and these have the most cushion. I am not a fan of the style, but I chose the comfort over style.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good value - If sale priced
customer_reviews.text: If disposable spikeless sneaker-type golf shoes are here to stay.....this is a good choice at the ~$50. range.
customer_reviews.author: VolvoX3

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight comfortable golf shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected- the wide allows a bit of extra room in the toe box- something my Fred Flinstone feet needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe, good support whilst playing, did not feel like I had any shoes on. This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Tongue cuts into your ankle
customer_reviews.text: The top of the tongue is to long and cuts into your ankle. I'll be returning these. It's too bad because they are comfortable, other than the tongue.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable and keep feet dry on morning tee times.
customer_reviews.author: George P

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Like the shoes, but the tongue is way too long, and wide at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best golf shoe to date
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit like a glove; very comfortable well made shoes. I'll probably reorder them.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus K. Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, except for tongue
customer_reviews.text: Had to turn the tongue down due to the sharp end irritating my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: sizes are 1/2 higher than described
customer_reviews.text: price was good. good return for size adjustment and prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: james f. horn

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy. Very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy. Have walked 18 holes with them numerous times now.
customer_reviews.author: John Mundt

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of ultraboost to go along with these, and these are probably the most comfortable golf shoes I own right now.
customer_reviews.author: John McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for a wide foot!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable pair of shoes right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: James Penney

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good support and grip and I like the looks.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and were comfortable. Walked 18 in them first time out without an insert. Only issue I noticed was that the black surfaces collected a lot of dust.
customer_reviews.author: Stauffcat

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and excellent traction
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and excellent traction for a spikeless golf shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit
customer_reviews.text: Good fit from the arch forward to the toes but very sloppy fit on the heal.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight but the tongue scratches the front of the Ankle
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN ESTRELLA

customer_reviews.title: So Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I own, golf or otherwise. Was a bit hesitant to try a spikeless shoe but no problems with slipping. Great comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the  money
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, or so I'm told by my son. Fit as expected, very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Radwanski

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for walkers
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe for a walking golfer who needs decent waterproofing. The tongue on the shoe is a little annoying since it’s slightly jagged, but overall the shoes comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: wear proper socks
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are nice and work well for golf. However be sure to have some socks that cover the top of your ankle. The thin tounge rubbed my ankle raw in a round of golf.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Wore out in just 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Played about 25 rounds and the cusion at the heel of the shoe wore out in two places making it unusable. It had a good fit and worked well but did not hold up at all with minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Duggan

customer_reviews.title: They did not fix my slice
customer_reviews.text: I am still terrible at golf. But I look good and am fairly comfortable. They are a little stiff at first and need to break in.
customer_reviews.author: SWDavis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe and service!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the type, color, and size I needed, delivered quickly without shipping charges. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fits great and ready to play right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: John Hangley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have wore them twice and they are wonderful. Fit perfect and are extremely comfortable. I would recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable golf shoes I’ve ever worn, also holding up well over use! I’ll buy these again and again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J Guzzetta

customer_reviews.title: Walk a mile or 14
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Walked 36 holes at Bandon Dunes, about 14 miles. That would not have happened in my pre ious pair
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Macpherson

customer_reviews.title: Comfort from the start
customer_reviews.text: We're great on the golf course. Really comfortable straight out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Emil DiPentima

customer_reviews.title: 2in 1 shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made, super comfortable. Wear them as my comfort tennis shoe now and bought another pair for golf!
customer_reviews.author: William B. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Mist comfortable golf shoe I’ve worn. I bought a second pair
customer_reviews.author: Rob A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gone 18 holes in these yet, but they are very comfortable and look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great Golf Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great golf shoes. Makes walking the fairways Like walking on a carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This show is the perfect combination of both value and performance. Great fit and very steady under your feet
customer_reviews.author: Tim Crist

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. I have wide feet and these fit great. Good arch support and very lite weight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite golf shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great all around shoe. Even wear them to walk my dogs in the hills.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fit is narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Fit narrow. Ordered a M but reordered a W. The W fit like I expected the M to dit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Sambrookes

customer_reviews.title: Golf Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and the tread is enough for holding your golfing stance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really like feel of the shoe and how light weight it is
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Feels like you aren’t even wearing shoes. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Kmac

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about the shoe just to small.
customer_reviews.text: It was a nice looking shoe just to small on instep.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Counter

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Only drawback is the tongue rubs against my instep when I am wearing shorts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L Bratt

customer_reviews.title: Go a size or half smaller
customer_reviews.text: 11's are like 12's, so now I'll just gift them out
customer_reviews.author: Beef

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and great sport shoes, was a good choice for me
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS E BRICEÑO S

customer_reviews.title: Tongue is very annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The box said 9.5W but were actually a narrow. They were returned.
customer_reviews.author: jmet

product_meta.title: adidas Men's Adipower 4orged S Golf Shoe
product_meta.description: Work the ball in the elements. These men's golf shoes feature breathable, water-repellent climastorm for wet conditions. They have a lightweight synthetic and textile upper for comfort and fit, and a boost midsole that offers responsive cushioning on every swing.
feature_bullets: Forged microfiber leather and textile upper with a thin TPU film
Puremotion spikeless outsole with strategically placed Adiwear traction
Flexible Bounce forefoot cushioning with responsive Boost midsole
Adaptive and breathable with soft stretch
